description: Dive into "Snapshots of Sandakan: Capture the Beauty" â€” a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Snapshots of Sandakan: Capture the Beauty

places.generalDescription: Sandakan District Mosque, also known as Masjid Besar Sim-Sim, is a futuristic and iconic mosque completed in 1990. It features stunning architecture and offers a magnificent view, especially during sunrise. The mosque serves as a place for Muslims to pray and also has an event hall for marriage ceremonies, preaching, and religious study. It is well-equipped and spacious with ample parking. Visitors appreciate the peaceful atmosphere and lovely sea view at this beautiful place of worship.

sources.snippet: Just before the Kampong Buli Sim Sim village is Sandakanâ€™s District Mosque. Completed in 1990, itâ€™s futuristic design and architecture make it well worth stopping at to admire as you walk past.
sources.shortName: The Best Things To Do In Sandakan, Sabah

places.name: Sandakan District Mosque

reviews.text: One of iconic mosque in Sandakan, also known as Masjid Besar Sim-Sim. Beautiful architecture and magnificent view; especially during sunrise.

Beautiful scenery
Place for a Muslim to pray
Clean environment
Lovely masjid to perform solat..peaceful place and have a awesome sea view

places.generalDescription: Located in the Kabili-Sepilok Forest Reserve, the Rainforest Discovery Centre (RDC) is an educational hub offering a variety of attractions. Visitors can explore a garden and enjoy guided walks while immersing themselves in nature. Nature Lodge, one of the top lodging options in the area, provides a refreshing swimming pool for guests' relaxation. The RDC's main highlights include a 363m long canopy walkway, exhibition halls, the Plant Discovery Garden, and environmental education programs.

sources.snippet: The centre highlights the rain forest ecosystems' contribution to biodiversity and has a fabulous botanical garden, perfect for picnicking. The center is within the Kabili-Sepilok Forest Reserve, with its Orangutan Rehabilitation Centre. Buses direct to Sepilok depart from Sandakan's Jl Pryer bus terminal, with minibus and taxi service also available for the 25 km (15 mile) trip.
sources.shortName: Sights in Sandakan

sources.snippet: A beautiful rainforest garden marks the site of a Japanese POW camp and the starting point for the infamous WWII 'death marches' to Ranau.
sources.shortName: Sandakan Heritage Museum | Sandakan, Malaysia | Attractions

sources.snippet: Located within the Kabili-Sepilok Forest Reserve (and just 2km from the Sepilok Orang-utan Rehabilitation Centre), the Rainforest Discovery Centre is an environmental education facility run by the Sabah Forestry Department. The Rainforest Discovery Walk is paved for the most part and wheelchair and stroller friendly. A rather intimidating 347-meter, long Canopy Walkway provides a birds-eye-view of the surrounding forest.
sources.shortName: First Time Visitor's Travel Guide To Sandakan, Malaysia

sources.snippet: An environmental education centre worth visiting, RDC is located within the famous Kabili-Sepilok Forest Reserve Centre which is also home to the Sepilok Orang Utan Rehabilitation Centre. All proceeds from ticket sales is used to sustain the centre and fund for its educational programmes for school children and teachers who visit them.
sources.shortName: 11 Must-Visit Places in Sandakan

sources.snippet: The Rainforest Development Centre is a haven for nature lovers. Whatâ€™s unique about this rainforest is the existence of multiple types of birds, so be sure to have a camera and telescope with you. You will do so on a 347-meter steel walkway in exploring the rainforest.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Best Things To Do in Sandakan, Malaysia

sources.snippet: Set nearby to Sepilok is the Sandakan Rainforest Discovery Centre. This preserved area of land is home to ancient trees, tropical flora and fauna and indigenous animals. Here you can stroll amongst and explore the treetops from canopy towers connected by walkways.
sources.shortName: The Best Things To Do In Sandakan, Sabah

sources.snippet: If you love the rainforest, you have to put this on your Sandakan Tour bucket list. Rainforest Discovery Center is situated in the Kabili-Sepilok Forest Reserve. It is one of the most popular environment education (EE) centers.
sources.shortName: SANDAKAN TOUR : 9 PLACES TO VISIT IN SANDAKAN

sources.snippet: Perhaps temples don't impress you -- you're rougher on the edges and prefer the surroundings of Mother Nature. The Rainforest Discovery Centre (RDC) will be right up your alley.
sources.shortName: Top 6 Places; Weekend Dose of Sandakan | Travelogue
Insta-Worthy Places in Sandakan, Sabah

places.name: Rainforest Discovery Centre (RDC)

reviews.text: Was undecided about visiting RDC (flight to catch and some of the reviews from here) but went ahead as weather was good. I am glad I did. It is a very well maintained park, litter free. Nature treks and paved walkways available. I managed to see 3 rhinoceros hornbill and some monkeys :) Also found sepilok giant tree and kalibi monster tree (25m) with a bit of help from other park visitors. I was there from 830-12noon. Park was not crowded, I saw less than 10 other park visitors during my time there. And had the suspension bridge all to myself for 15 mins. Highly recommended if you go to sepilok. The bird watching towers have amazing views. I learnt that white is an alarm color for birds (and bright florescent colors). PS: I wasn't bitten by any mosquitos (shorts, no insect repellent)

Amazing place to explore Borneo's rainforest, both by day and night. Night walks are organized, make sure to book in advance at the ticket counter once here.

The canopy walkways are a highlight, offering unique views of the jungle.

Long hiking trails available-trekking shoes and mosquito repellent highly recommended.

Entry is paid and credit cards are not accepted.

Plan to spend 3â€“4 hours.

Amazing place. We were lucky enough to see an orangutan climbing some trees and eating.
The whole place looks amazing. It's truly beautiful to see in real life untouched nature.

The bridges that go into the jungle provide an amazing view from the canopy.

The walks along the floor feel like you're walking through the jungle but with a comfortable steady path.

Curb your expectations of seeing loads of animals though. We were there 2 hrs and only saw one. Plus some ants.

It's worth it though it's truly beautiful and like nothing else.

places.address: Jalan Fabia, Sepilok, 90715 Sandakan, Sabah, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Puu Jih Syh Temple, a Chinese-style Buddhist temple built in 1987, is perched on a hill overlooking Sandakan Bay. It is the largest Chinese temple in Sandakan and offers panoramic views of the city and the Sulu Sea. The temple is dedicated to Kuan Yin, the Goddess of Mercy and Passion. Visitors can witness cultural festivities during Chinese New Year and enjoy the peaceful environment for prayer and blessings.

sources.shortName: Sandakan Heritage Museum | Sandakan, Malaysia | Attractions

sources.snippet: In contrast to the Puu Jih Syh Temple, Sam Sing Kung Temple (also known locally as the Three Saints Temple) is a small, non-flashy place of worship with a wealth of history. It is part of Sandakanâ€™s heritage trail and was built in 1887, making it one of the oldest temples in the city.
sources.shortName: 17 Incredible Things To Do In Sandakan BorneoðŸ¥°
Insta-Worthy Places in Sandakan, Sabah

places.name: Puu Jih Syh Temple

reviews.text: The view from the temple is amazing. You can see half the Sandakan town and also the sea from here. It's refreshing to come here for sight seeing.
Ornate, colourful temple typical of Buddhist temples. The prayer hall in large with three impressive gold Buddhas. View from outside, over the Sandakan bay is scenic.
Good views from the top down to the bay, I'm rating these 3 stars as im comparing it architecturally to all temples I've visited in Asia Pacific

places.generalDescription: St. Michael's and All Angels Church in Sandakan is a picturesque colonial-era Anglican church that resembles a traditional English village church. Situated on a small hill, the church offers scenic views but has a history of being built by prisoners who manually dragged stones up the hill. The church boasts beautiful stained-glass windows donated to commemorate the end of World War II, and it also houses two time capsules buried beneath a memorial on its grounds.

sources.snippet: St. Michaelâ€™s & All Angels Church looks exactly like a traditional English village church and was built in the colonial period in the typical style. The church enjoys a scenic location atop a small hill although spare a thought for those who built it as prisoners had to drag the stones up the hill by hand. Some highlights to look out for here include the pretty stained-glass windows that were put it as a commemoration of the 60th anniversary of the end of the Second World War.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things To Do In Sandakan (Malaysia)

sources.snippet: The St. Michael and All Angels Church is one of the oldest stone churches in Sabah. Built during colonial period, it is also one of the few remains that survived from major damage during WWII. In this church, you will be able to see beautiful stained glass windows donated by a well-known traditional stained-glass artists, Philip Handel, to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the end of World War 2.
sources.shortName: Things To Do in Sandakan (2025)

sources.snippet: Known for being the oldest stone church in Sabah, St. Michaelâ€™s and All Angels Church is part of the Sandakan Heritage Trails. The Anglican church itself is a piece of history from the British Colonisation period in Borneo. One of its beautiful attraction is its stained glass window donated by the Australians to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the end of the World War II.
sources.shortName: 11 Must-Visit Places in Sandakan

sources.snippet: However, bombed and burned during WWII, a major restoration was completed in the 1950s. Before the bombing, the Japanese army took the church for military use and transient stays for POWs. Today, youâ€™ll find magnificent stained-glass windows in the church, installed as an appreciation by the family members of POWs to the local community for their support during wartime.
sources.shortName: 17 Incredible Things To Do In Sandakan BorneoðŸ¥°

sources.snippet: The St. Michael and All Angels Church is the oldest stone church in Sabah. The construction of the church began in 1888 and took nearly 13 years to complete. Reverend W.H. Elton initiated the lofty project, which was designed by New Zealander B.W. Mountfort and inspired by the Christchurch Cathedral in New Zealand.
sources.shortName: First Time Visitor's Travel Guide To Sandakan, Malaysia

sources.snippet: Famous attractions in Sandakan are the Sandakan War Memorial Park, Sandakan Big Market, Phu Jih Shih Temple, Labuk Bay, St Michael Cathedral, All Angels Cathedral, Buli Sim Sim and Agnes Keith House.
sources.shortName: Sandakan, city in Malaysia | Wonderful Malaysia

places.name: St. Michael's and All Angels Church, Sandakan

reviews.text:
One of the highlights of our Sandakan trip is visiting this 130 yr old Anglican stone church that features a Gothic architectural design. The church was partially destroyed during WWII and was rebuilt after the war.
The exterior is constructed with rugged stone walls and pointed arches. The roof is steeply pitched and covered with slate roof tiles.
The windows on both ends of the hall are adorned with intricate stained-glass designs, depicting biblical scenes and saints.
As I step inside, immediately noticed the cool, slightly musty scent of aged stone and wood. The interior is spacious and filled with light filtering through the tall glass panels.
Near the entrance is a memorial plaque on the wall commemorating parishioners from the past.
Overall, the ambience of the church is one of solemn beauty that fostering a deep sense of connection to tradition, spirituality, and the sacred.
A beautiful local church with a fascinating and heartbreaking Australian history connected to the Sandakan prisoner of war camp from WWII.

This Anglican church is the first and oldest stone church in the State of Sabah, completed build in 1925. The church is located on a hill, so walking up can be quite tiring for some. Entry fee is Rm5 and can see the interior with the supervision of the church assistant. Great architecture and design evoking Christian spirituality.
It is part of the Sandakan Heritage Trail.

places.address: 51, Jalan Puncak, Pusat Bandar Sandakan, 90000 Sandakan, Sabah, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Agnes Keith House is a restored post-WWII residence that once belonged to the renowned American author, Agnes Keith, and her husband Henry Harry Keith. The house has been transformed into a museum showcasing the couple's life in Sandakan through informative displays and a collection of genuine and replicated antiques. This historic house incorporates American, British, and local architectural elements, offering visitors a glimpse into the idyllic times spent by the Keiths.

sources.snippet: On a hill overlooking town and Sandakan Bay, the home of author Agnes Newton Keith is a trip back in time. American-born Keith came to Sandakan in the 1930s with her British husband, a North Borneo Company official, and wrote books about her experiences. "The Land Below the Wind" introduced Sabah to many Europeans, and "Three Came Home," chronicling Keith's captivity in a Japanese prison camp during World War II, is Keith's best-known work.
sources.shortName: Sights in Sandakan

sources.snippet: This atmospheric two-storey colonial villa, Newlands, tells the story of American writer Agnes Keith and her British husband Harry, the Conservator ofâ€¦
sources.shortName: Sandakan Heritage Museum | Sandakan, Malaysia | Attractions

sources.snippet: Previously occupied by the British Colonial Government, the American writer Agnes Keith moved into the building after they moved out, dubbing it the Agnes Keith House. It is also the house where she spent most of her time writing her beloved books, mainly centred around her time in Borneo. The Agnes Keith House is now both a museum and a heritage house, educating visitors on how people lived their lives during the time of British North Borneo.
sources.shortName: Cultural Attractions in Sandakan

sources.snippet: The Agnes Keith House spans two floors and is a traditional villa made of wood that is built in the colonial style. The house has now been turned into a museum and would have been the former home of Agnes Keith who was an American writer who lived here in the 1930s. Some of Keithâ€™s most famous works about Sandakan include â€˜Land Below the Windâ€™ but bear in mind that you will need to climb some one hundred steps to get to the house.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things To Do In Sandakan (Malaysia)

sources.snippet: However, bombed and burned during WWII, a major restoration was completed in the 1950s. Before the bombing, the Japanese army took the church for military use and transient stays for POWs. Today, youâ€™ll find magnificent stained-glass windows in the church, installed as an appreciation by the family members of POWs to the local community for their support during wartime.
sources.shortName: 17 Incredible Things To Do In Sandakan BorneoðŸ¥°

sources.snippet: Although this preserved historic house turn museum doesnâ€™t look anything special, it has a very interesting story to tell. Inside is a fascinating exhibition that details the life and achievements of Agnes Keith. An American author who lived as an expat in Sandakan, Keith is most well known for her autobiographical books about life in Northern British Borneo.
sources.shortName: The Best Things To Do In Sandakan, Sabah

sources.snippet: If youâ€™re a fan of colonial style architecture, then you will appreciate the Agnes Keith House. This once upon a time British colonial government quarters, known as â€˜Newlandsâ€™, was the home to Henry George Keith, his wife Agnes and son George. Henry Keith was the Assistant Conservator of Forests for the governor of North Borneo.
sources.shortName: First Time Visitor's Travel Guide To Sandakan, Malaysia

sources.snippet: Also part of the Sandakan Heritage Trail, the Agnes Keith House holds much history within its walls. The famous American writer herself lived there together with her husband Henry/Harry and their son George. The house provides an interesting insight about the life of Agnes as well as the British North Borneo period.
sources.shortName: 11 Must-Visit Places in Sandakan

sources.snippet: We had a little bit of time to spare on our last day, so we decided to stop by the Agnes Keith House. This British colonial house is a tribute to American writer, Agnes Keith, who lived there during the 1930s as she documented her life and experiences in Sandakan into 3 books.
sources.shortName: Top 6 Places; Weekend Dose of Sandakan | Travelogue

sources.snippet: The Agnes Keith House is the historic former home of the prominent American writer named Agnes Keith. In fact, she wrote two famous novels on the hill where this house was eventually built. When she permanently left Malaysia, visitors still frequently saw the house.
sources.shortName: Top 15 Best Things To Do in Sandakan, Malaysia

sources.snippet: Famous attractions in Sandakan are the Sandakan War Memorial Park, Sandakan Big Market, Phu Jih Shih Temple, Labuk Bay, St Michael Cathedral, All Angels Cathedral, Buli Sim Sim and Agnes Keith House.
sources.shortName: Sandakan, city in Malaysia | Wonderful Malaysia

places.name: Agnes Keith House

reviews.text: A very beautiful Malay traditional house with a hint of western touch. I think they include other item not related to Agnes Keith here which is quite interesting. Those with student cards are free to enter. All the staff was very friendly and nice to us. There are lockers outside to store your things. It's very comfortable and cold inside the house.

One of the landmarks included in the Sandakan Heritage Trail, Agnes Keith's House can be located on top of a small hill and is the next stop after finishing the 100 Steps trail. It's an easy hike surrounded by trees and sounds of nature which can be a great walk granted that there is also a nice weather. The house itself if beautiful. It is well-maintained and does represent a point in time where the lifestyle and architecture were different compared to the modern design of houses today. There's definitely an appeal to it and especially with its beautiful garden, I wouldn't mind living in this one.

This residentisl house is a must to visit, it's very clean, well preserved and supercool temp with airconditioning. Guests are requested to takeoff shoes when visiting . Its display is very well organized, not too informative. Minimal exhibition  but a lot of knowledge is learned from the life of owners, pictures and their daily furniture. Outside garddn is very well maintained, it's very worthy F or admission fee for 15 MYR (nonmalaysian)

places.generalDescription: Sandakan Memorial Park is a significant historical site that offers visitors a glimpse into the harrowing past of Borneo during World War II. It was once a Japanese POW camp where Australian and British prisoners endured unimaginable hardships, with only six Australian escapees surviving by 1945. Today, the park stands as a serene forest orchard and gardens, providing an ideal setting for contemplative walks.

sources.snippet: At the site of the World War II Japanese POW camp, where the infamous "death marches" to Ranau began, Sandakan Memorial Park commemorates the 1,800 Australian and 600 British soldiers imprisoned hereâ€”of which only six escapees survivedâ€”along with local residents who risked their lives to assist them. Today, the grounds are a quiet wooded area dotted with rusting hulks of machinery from the camp's forced labor program. A pavilion at the center of park includes testimony from the survivors, plus photographs from guards, inmates, and liberators.
sources.shortName: Sights in Sandakan
Sandakan Heritage Museum | Sandakan, Malaysia | Attractions

sources.snippet: Sandakan Memorial Park is one of the most important historical sites in Sabah and lies in an area of forest land that is separated into different lush gardens. This site used to be a Japanese prisoner-of-war camp during the Second World War and was also used as the place where prisoners would begin the horrific â€˜death marchesâ€™ which would take them to Ranau. To put the tragedy of this area in perspective, 1800 Australians and 600 British troops where imprisoned in the camp and only six Australians survived after they managed to escape.
sources.shortName: 25 Best Things To Do In Sandakan (Malaysia)

sources.snippet: Tucked in a rainforest parted by several lavish parks, Sandakan Memorial Park is one of the most significant memorial parks in Sabah, acting as a remembrance to the Australian and British prisoners who have lost their lives during World War II. The site was once a Japanese POW camp where the detainees started the infamous "death march" that would take them to Ranau, Kota Kinabalu. Within the park, you can see photos of the prisoners as well as the machinery and wartime relics placed in their original position during WWII.
sources.shortName: Things To Do in Sandakan (2025)

sources.snippet: Located 11km from Sandakan city, the Sandakan Memorial Park is the site of a former World War II prison camp. With its careful landscaping and modern signboards, the park is almost too sterile, aside from a few rusty pieces of forgotten machinery dotting the grounds. But for those who are acquainted with the past horrors of this site, the quiet whispers of nature could easily be interpreted as the whispers of the dead.
sources.shortName: First Time Visitor's Travel Guide To Sandakan, Malaysia

sources.snippet: No doubt the most famous attraction in Sandakan, tourists travel to Borneo from all over the world with the main purpose of visiting the Sepilok Orangutan Rehabilitation Centre. Orphaned and injured orangutans are brought here for medical treatment and care, before being released back into the wild. The centre is built within a reserve and lucky visitors can often observe released orangutans in their natural habitat.
sources.shortName: 17 Incredible Things To Do In Sandakan BorneoðŸ¥°

sources.snippet: The Sandakan War Memorial was established to honour those who served and fought in the war, especially those who were captured and kept as prisoners during WWII by the Japanese. The site was infamously known as the Prisoner of War Camp (POW). Today, it is a park with beautiful green landscapes for easy-going exploring.
sources.shortName: 11 Must-Visit Places in Sandakan

sources.snippet: Famous attractions in Sandakan are the Sandakan War Memorial Park, Sandakan Big Market, Phu Jih Shih Temple, Labuk Bay, St Michael Cathedral, All Angels Cathedral, Buli Sim Sim and Agnes Keith House.
sources.shortName: Sandakan, city in Malaysia | Wonderful Malaysia

places.name: Sandakan Memorial Park

reviews.text:
Visit on: 17 Aug 2025
Arrived around 12pm and not much people walking here. Walking relax along the park (which nearby to housing area though) and it is quite suitable for jogging. Free entrance to the sandakan commerative pavilion and with air-conditioned.

A peaceful park that serves as a memorial about the horrors and thousands (2500?) of deaths of the Allied POWs during the Japanese occupation. Not a lot to see from a historical angle, but valuable as a memorial.

If you really really really really have lots of time, then you can consider visiting this place. There is nothing special about it. Lots of irritating mosquitoes. One can spend at most 25 mins here. There is parking available. Plenty of signs to show the exact places for POWs. There is a pond to take nice pictures. Can bring along fish food to feed the hungry fishes.

places.generalDescription: Pandafilm Studio Sandakan, situated in the charming city of Sandakan, Sabah, Malaysia, is a renowned destination for capturing timeless moments with loved ones. With an exceptional reputation and high praise from clients, this studio is celebrated for its ability to encapsulate love and togetherness in exquisite family portraits. Boasting impeccable service and unwavering dedication to quality, Pandafilm Studio Sandakan has earned the title of the best in town.

sources.snippet: Introducing Pandafilm Studio Sandakan, the perfect destination for capturing timeless and cherished moments with your loved ones. Located at 22, Lor Prima 8, in the picturesque city of Sandakan, Sabah, Malaysia, this headshots studio has garnered an exceptional reputation within the local community.With an impressive rating of 4.9 out of 5 stars based on 17 reviews, Pandafilm Studio Sandakan is undoubtedly the go-to destination for family photoshoots. Clients praise the studio for its ability to encapsulate the essence of love and togetherness in their photographs, resulting in exquisite family portraits that are bound to be treasured for generations to come.Impeccable service and an unwavering dedication to quality have earned Pandafilm Studio Sandakan the title of the best in town.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Sandakan Best Professional Headshot Photo Studios

places.name: Pandafilm Studio Sandakan

reviews.text: Perfect place to take family photos..

(Translated by Google) Best ðŸ‘ðŸ‘

(Original)
Terbaik ðŸ‘ðŸ‘

places.generalDescription: NOMOSH STUDIO & AZKA WHITE HALL in Sandakan, Sabah, Malaysia is a top-rated photography studio offering a range of services including wedding and maternity photography. Located at Bandar Nasalim, Mile 5, Corner-Lot 8, 1st & 2nd Floor, Jln Lintas Utara, it has gained a reputation for excellence. The studio is known for its clean and customer-friendly environment where clients can easily negotiate and conduct business.

sources.snippet: Looking for an exceptional photography experience in Sandakan, Sabah, Malaysia?. Look no further than NOMOSH STUDIO & AZKA WHITE HALL, a top-rated headshots studio that has garnered a perfect 5/5 stars based on five rave reviews. Located at Bandar Nasalim, Mile 5, Corner-Lot 8, 1st & 2nd Floor, Jln Lintas Utara, Sandakan, this studio offers an array of services, specializing in wedding, maternity, and various other photography genres.At NOMOSH STUDIO & AZKA WHITE HALL, excellence is their hallmark.
sources.shortName: Top 5 Sandakan Best Professional Headshot Photo Studios

places.name: NOMOSH STUDIO , AZKA WHITE HALL EVENT SPACE , NOMOSH DECOR

reviews.text: very nice taste â¤ï¸
Over all tasty in nommosh
An attractive place. Clean and customer-friendly. Easy to negotiate and conduct business.

places.address: 1st Floor, BANDAR NASALIM ,MILE 5, CORNER, LOT 7 & 8, Jln Lintas Utara, 90000 Sandakan, Sabah, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Kinabatangan Wildlife Sanctuary is a nature lover's paradise located near the 344-mile long Kinabatangan River. It offers the chance to spot various wild animals such as crocodiles, orangutans, proboscis monkeys, and pygmy elephants. The sanctuary is well-placed around the river and boasts rich biodiversity with beautiful birds, making it a paradise for bird watchers.

sources.snippet: An irony of deforestation and plantation development is that surviving forest areas become home to a wide variety of wildlife that once occupied a far larger range. The Kinabatangan River flows through rain forest, freshwater swamps, and mangroves, harboring monitor lizards, reticulated pythons, pigtailed macaques, proboscis monkeys, orangutan, and even elephants. Bird life includes such spectacular creatures as the Asian paradise flycatcher, stork-billed kingfisher, brahminy kite, and several species of hornbill venerated by Borneo's indigenous people.
sources.shortName: Sights in Sandakan

places.name: Kinabatangan Wildlife Sanctuary

reviews.text:
Kinabatangan River was an amazing experience that provided so much diverse wildlife.

With palm plantations encroaching towards the river, the wildlife is essentially funneled into the forest that aligns with the river. The result is you see a lot more wildlife than you would see in the primary rainforest was my experience.

That being said we saw Orangutans, all types of monkeys including proboscis, salt water crocodiles, otters and so many birds. This included hornbills, kingfishers, storks, egret. Unfortunately we did not see pygmy elephant.

If you have limited time in Borneo, this is the easiest way of viewing wildlife in their natural habitat. In terms of accommodation I recomend the Last Frontier Resort.

The best way to see this wildlife is via boat and most accommodation on the river provide guides and boat tours in both the morning and afternoon.
Very good tour. We had a very knowledgeable tour guide who was able to share his knowledge of the animals with us during the tour. Would recommend adding this to your itinerary if you're in sepilok
We did a 2-hour river cruise there. It's a good experience. Need luck to see the rarer animals in the wild. We were lucky to see an orangutan.

places.generalDescription: Sandakan Waterfront is a must-visit destination offering a relaxing atmosphere with various activities to enjoy. The area has been revitalized with a new pedestrian walkway, providing an excellent vantage point to admire the stunning views of Sandakan Bay. Visitors can take leisurely strolls, dine in restaurants, explore markets, and unwind in cafes while taking in the picturesque panorama. Additionally, it's an ideal spot for fishing, hiking, and picnicking.

sources.snippet: Visiting the cityâ€™s picturesque waterfront is one of the best things to do in Sandakan on an evening. Restaurants line and light up the sea wall with tables and chairs set out right on the waterâ€™s edge. Itâ€™s a lively place that attracts both tourists and locals with cheap, tasty Malaysian dishes and seafood being served up fresh.
sources.shortName: The Best Things To Do In Sandakan, Sabah

places.name: Sandakan Waterfront

reviews.text: Sandakan Waterfront offers scenic views and a variety of dining options, potential visitors should be aware of the mixed reviews and set their expectations accordingly.

A very dirty and smelly area of the city. Filled with people whose citizenship status is questionable. The prices of food and drinks in most of the premises are quite not worth the quality and quantity of each dish.
NEVER A DULL MOMENT! Kuching Waterfront is a must-go place when you visit Kuching. Parking spaces are a bit hard to find bcs this place never failed to attract tourists and even local citizens.

places.address: Pusat Bandar Sandakan, 90000 Sandakan, Sabah, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Sandakan Crocodile Farm, also known as the Sandakan Crocodile Rehabilitation Centre, is a conservation and breeding facility housing over 3,000 crocodiles. The farm offers guided tours for visitors to observe these reptiles in a controlled environment. While you can't wrestle with the crocodiles, you can witness them being fed. The farm plays a crucial role in conserving these creatures and their habitats. It's an essential stop for wildlife enthusiasts visiting Sandakan.

sources.snippet: Outside the city the following attractions are worth a visit: Sepilok (entrance fee RM30, camera fee RM10), the canopy walk at the Rainforest Directory Centre, Turtle Island (Selingan Island), Lankayan Island, Libaran Island (for relaxing, river cruises or night fishing), Crocodile Farm, Heritage Trail, Gomantong Caves and the Labuk Bay Proboscis Monkey Sanctuary.
sources.shortName: Sandakan, city in Malaysia | Wonderful Malaysia

places.name: Sandakan Crocodile Farm

reviews.text:
Well, the name of this place already explains what is there. I have many beautiful memories here. From childhood, to youth, to the time of love with (now wife) until now the time of family with 3 blessed children.

I pray, if given the chance, I will have time and energy to visit this place again with my grandchildren.

You better not to pray that I come here again when I am gone. ðŸ¤£

It was mid afternoon and the sun was shining brightly. Good thing the whole area â€¦walkway,,, was shaded. There were many crocodiles there big and bigger â€¦and some little ones too. For a first timer here, i was amazed at their sight. â€¦. First timer okâ€¦.and it was an experience too.
There were other animals tooâ€¦more than 8 different animals if I'm not mistaken and for me, the RM10.00 for a senior citizen like me (or RM12 for the younger ones) was worth it. Spent nearly a leisurely hour there to enjoy the experience.

Not too bad
It's like a mini zoo in Sandakan, but they really need to improve their maintenance. Most of the animals are crocodiles, but there are also others like rabbits, chickens, birds, and an ostrich with only a few feathers haha (maybe because it is old).
The crocodile feeding happens at 9:30 AM. Nothing too fancy, but at least it's something.
Price â€“ RM12 for adults.
Worth it? Maybe for my kid, but for me, it felt a bit pricey.
Plenty parking - free too

places.address: Mile 8, Jalan Labuk, 90000 Sandakan, Sabah, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Kinabatangan Oxbow Lake is a must-visit destination in Sandakan, Malaysia, known for its wildlife and nature tours. It's a beautiful lake formed from a meander of the Kinabatangan River and is home to various bird species, monkeys, monitor lizards, and the snake bird. Many lodges in Sukau and Bilit offer trips to this pristine lake where Nat Geo, BBC, and Lonely Planet have filmed rainforest scenes.

sources.snippet: The mighty Kinabatangan River is renowned as the second largest river in Malaysia. It's a must visit whilst in Sandakan.
sources.shortName: Top 6 Places; Weekend Dose of Sandakan | Travelogue

places.name: Kinabatangan Oxbow Lake

reviews.text:
Oxbow Lake at Kinabatangan is one of the must-visit places when you come here for wildlife, bird & nature tours. Most lodges at Sukau and Bilit will at least have one trip to the famous Oxbow Lake here in Sukau.

This is my 3rd time visiting this beautiful place for birdwatching, and I was pleased to see that the Lake is still as pristine as before. The journey going into the lake is where the majority of the Nat Geo, BBC, and Lonely Planet video footage is shot, for rainforest scenes.
Beautiful lake created when a meander of the Kinabatangan River remained isolated from the river itself. Many birds and monkeys to admire.
My favourite place on earth I think. I'll add monitor lizards and the brilliant snake bird. Oh to be there again.
